partial_orders.reason: Edit 0 changes the call to _ESJsonLogFmt constructor to pass an additional parameter 'self.json_fields', while Edit 1 changes the _ESJsonLogFmt constructor signature to accept this new 'json_fields' parameter. These edits reference the exact same symbol (_ESJsonLogFmt constructor) and create a direct code dependency - after making either edit, the other becomes the immediate next step to maintain code consistency. The call-site update and signature change are mechanically linked through the same constructor symbol.

Edit 0 modifies a logging formatter to add '- %(exc_text)s' to the format string. Edit 1 updates the corresponding test assertion to expect the new format with the additional '- ' at the end (representing the exc_text field when it's empty). These edits reference the exact same logging format pattern - one defines the new format and the other updates the test expectation for that same format. The test assertion must be updated to match the new formatter pattern, creating a direct code dependency where either edit naturally prompts the other as the next mechanical step.
